title: Jean-Marc Doussain
text:
Jean-Marc Doussain (born 12 February 1991) is a French <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> <a href="fly%20half">fly half</a>. He plays club rugby for <a href="Stade%20Toulousain">Stade Toulousain</a> and has appeared for the French national U20 side. He made his debut for <a href="French%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">France</a> with 5 minutes left of the <a href="2011%20Rugby%20World%20Cup%20Final">2011 Rugby World Cup Final</a>, becoming the first player ever to make his Test debut in a Rugby World Cup Final. Doussain wasn't initially named in the squad and was only called up as an injury replacement for <a href="David%20Skrela">David Skrela</a>.
Doussain was born in <a href="Sainte-Croix-Volvestre">Sainte-Croix-Volvestre</a> and played for Saint-Girons rugby club before signing for Toulouse in 2007, at the age of 17. His father, Jean Doussain, was also a rugby player, having played at <a href="Scrum-half%20%28rugby%20union%29">scrum-half</a> for <a href="Stade%20Saint-Gaudinois">Stade Saint-Gaudinois</a> in the 1980s. Doussain made his first full appearance for Toulouse on 28 November 2009, against Montauban. His current contract commits him to Toulouse until the end of the 2014 season.
